page.title: 01LUTTON AND THE GEDNEYS
page.content: This part of the {Lincolnshire Fens}is one of the most intensely {cultivated} parts of England. The landscape is{ {typically}flat with only minor undulations in the field surfaces to break the monotony.Huge skies and panoramic views are the norm.Villages are scattered with small nucleated settlements around village churches or farming centres. Farms fall into no{ {particular category},varying from large multi company co-operatives, through to small family concerns working a few acres. The main village centres are at {Lutton and Gedney,both {}are clustered around churches of varying architectural note,Gedney Dyke has no such feature, and probably has its origins as an agricultural centre,although much modern building has changed the nature of the village. { }
